text: @HarshitaMurarka It does happen to freelancers, and it totally sucks. But yeah, if they refuse to pay you, you could have attorney write a demand letter, send the invoice to collections or have a union reach out to the publication on your behalf.

text: @HarshitaMurarka Depends. If we have a contract that has a clause outlining a kill fee, then the client needs to pay. I'd invoice for the kill fee. If the money owed is substantial enough the client refuses to pay, I'd ask an attorney to write a demand letter or send it to a collections agency.

nouns: contract clause kill client invoice kill money client attorney demand letter collection agency
